meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling an amphora.
meanings.sent1: The amphoral design of the vase caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The artist created an amphoral sculpture for the exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The amphoral shape of the cake made it look like a giant vase.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back in an amphoral fashion.
meanings.sent5: The clouds in the sky formed an amphoral pattern, resembling ancient pottery.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the shape of an amphora.
meanings.sent1: The amphoral curves of the amphora were beautifully crafted.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist studied the amphoral artifacts found at the site.
meanings.sent3: The amphoral outline of the mountain resembled an ancient vase.
meanings.sent4: His voice had an amphoral quality, echoing through the amphitheater.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with an amphoral glow, like a giant urn.

meanings.definition: Resembling an amphora in shape or function.
meanings.sent1: The amphoral handles on the jug made it easy to carry.
meanings.sent2: The amphoral storage containers were used in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The amphoral appearance of the building gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: The amphoral structure of the bridge mirrored that of a classic vase.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with amphoral planters, adding a touch of antiquity.
